meanings.definition: The period of greatest power, vigor, success, or influence; prime.
meanings.sent1: During its heydey, the company was at the peak of success.
meanings.sent2: The heydey of the circus was when the acrobats performed breathtaking stunts.
meanings.sent3: In its heydey, the old car could outrun even the fastest vehicles.
meanings.sent4: The heydey of the garden was when the flowers bloomed in a riot of colors.
meanings.sent5: The heydey of the party was when everyone danced under the twinkling lights.

meanings.definition: A time of great excitement or activity.
meanings.sent1: The heydey of the festival brought joy to all who attended.
meanings.sent2: In the heydey of summer, the children played outside from dawn till dusk.
meanings.sent3: During the heydey of the game, the players cheered and high-fived.
meanings.sent4: The heydey of the city market was bustling with shoppers and vendors.
meanings.sent5: The heydey of the concert was when the crowd sang along to every song.
